description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Gregory Korte outlines the White House plan to shed government workers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Team Trump Set to Drop the Hammer on Federal Workforce

description: A federal judge extended a temporary order blocking President Donald Trump from firing the head of an independent US agency that protects government whistleblowers, even as the White House aims to get the case on a fast-track to the Supreme Court.
title: Judge Extends Block on Trump Firing Whistleblower Agency Head

description: New Zealand’s government has agreed to consider legislation that would enable the parliamentary term to be extended to four years from three, subject to a referendum that could be held as soon as next year.
title: New Zealand Eyes Referendum on Four-Year Parliamentary Term

description: Training for US diplomats will abandon the use of certain words related to diversity and inclusion, according to new State Department guidelines that also call for dropping references to DEI programs enacted under President Joe Biden.
title: US Drops DEI Terms in Future Diplomat Training After Trump Order

description: Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.’s decision to move its head office to New York from Toronto is causing trouble for Mark Carney in his run for Canadian prime minister.
title: Brookfield’s Move From Toronto Becomes Flashpoint for Carney in Political Race

description: New research suggests President Donald Trump’s latest tariffs on imports from China could hit the American economy more than official US trade data indicate.
title: Tariffs on China Risk Hurting US Economy More Than Data Suggest

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to revoke an oil license to operate in Venezuela, citing the country’s failure to take back migrants to the US as quickly as it promised.
title: Trump Revoking Venezuela Oil License in Blow to Maduro Regime

description: The president announced the outline of a program that will offer residency or a pathway to citizenship for people willing to make a large payment.
title: What to Know About Trump’s $5 Million ‘Gold Card’ Visa Plan

description: Bulgaria’s Constitutional Court ordered a full recount of the country’s latest snap election in a move that may threaten the Balkan country’s ruling majority.
title: Bulgarian Constitutional Court Orders Recount of October Vote

description: French President Emmanuel Macron was set to host next German chancellor Friederich Merz for a work dinner Wednesday to talk about Ukraine and other subjects, his office said.
title: Macron to Host Next German Chancellor to Discuss Trump, Ukraine

description: Chicago’s City Council on Wednesday approved Mayor Brandon Johnson’s controversial proposal to sell $830 million in bonds for infrastructure costs despite concerns about the debt’s delayed repayment schedule and who would get to use the proceeds.
title: Chicago City Council Passes Controversial $830 Million Bond Plan

description: US and Russian officials have identified the Arctic as a possible area for economic cooperation, according to people familiar with the situation, part of the broader detente President Donald Trump is pursuing with Moscow.
title: US, Russia Mull Cooperation on Arctic Trade Routes, Exploration

description: President Donald Trump’s pick to head the Justice Department’s civil rights division told senators that Target Corp. may have acted illegally in pledging to increase the representation of Black employees across its workforce.
title: Trump Civil Rights Pick Says Target’s DEI Efforts May Be Illegal

description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday gave a series of apparently contradictory answers about his plans to enact tariffs on Canada and Mexico, as well as the European Union.
title: Trump Sows Confusion Around Global Tariffs Timing, Scope

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is planning to consolidate government-wide purchasing efforts into a single agency, dismissing contract officers as it seeks to make sweeping cuts to federal spending, according to an official familiar with the effort.
title: Trump Agencies Move to Centralize Contracts in Bid to Cut Costs

description: Mexico’s peso and Canada’s dollar got a boost after US President Donald Trump pushed back the deadline for levies on goods from both countries.
title: Mexico Peso, Canada Dollar Get Boost After Trump Delays Tariffs

description: The Republican leaders of three US House committees have begun an investigation into what they called China’s “systematic exploitation” of two federal funding programs that the Pentagon and other agencies use to tap innovation by American startups and small businesses.
title: Lawmakers Probe Alleged China Abuse of US Programs for Startups

description: President Donald Trump said he didn’t want to comment when asked Wednesday whether it was the policy of his administration to prevent China from taking control of Taiwan by force.
title: Trump Declines to Say If US Would Protect Taiwan From Invasion

description: President Donald Trump said American businesses could purchase his proposed “gold cards” to help keep students of Ivy League and other top universities in the country after they graduate, defending an initiative aimed at drawing wealthy individuals as immigrants to the US.
title: ‘Gold Cards’ Can Help Firms Hire Ivy League Grads, Trump Says

description: Israel and Hamas agreed to exchange the bodies of four hostages for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners later Wednesday, the final swap in a fractious six-week ceasefire due to end this weekend.
title: Israel, Hamas Say Hostage and Prisoner Swap to Go Ahead Wednesday

description: At home, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has framed his trip to meet Donald Trump as a bid to save Ukraine and the trans-Atlantic alliance. At the White House, he’ll argue that the US president needs Europe to come out a winner.
title: Starmer Tries to Buy Ukraine Time With Security Pitch to Trump

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent named a Wall Street and military veteran to advise on plans for a sovereign wealth fund, taking a further step toward fulfilling President Donald Trump’s idea for the US to join the ranks of nations with such assets.
title: Treasury Names Adviser to Help Plan US Sovereign Wealth Fund

description: President Donald Trump said the approximately 1 million federal workers who did not respond to billionaire Elon Musk’s demand to explain their activities are at risk of losing their jobs.
title: Trump Says Federal Workers Who Ignored Musk Risk Losing Jobs

description: Opinion polls that showed President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity slumping to all-time lows are complicating central bank efforts to engineer the economic slowdow needed to tame Brazil’s persistent inflation.
title: Lula’s Falling Approval Is Making It Hard to Tame Inflation in Brazil

description: The US Supreme Court signaled it will revive a job-bias lawsuit by a straight woman and make it easier for members of so-called “majority groups” to get to a jury with discrimination claims.
title: Supreme Court Signals Backing for Straight Woman’s Job-Bias Suit

description: The White House told federal agencies to submit plans by March 13 for “large-scale reductions in force,” the first phase of an effort to drastically reduce the size of the US government.
title: White House Orders Agencies to Prepare ‘Large-Scale’ Staff Cuts

description: The US is stepping up egg imports and boosting support to chicken farmers to combat its worst-ever outbreak of avian flu that’s sent egg prices to a record of over $8 a dozen.
title: US to Boost Egg Imports, Farm Relief as Prices Soar on Bird Flu

description: France’s development agency is reviewing its investment in a company that owns a Ugandan for-profit hospital, following a Bloomberg News report that found facilities in low-income countries had detained or turned away poor patients.
title: Proparco Reviews Hospital Investment After Detention Reports

description: The White House hand picked the first group of outlets for a new system of media access in which it chooses who is able to cover President Donald Trump in certain settings, limiting the role of the three main newswires that traditionally distribute news of the presidency around the world.
title: White House Limits Newswires in Press Pool Takeover

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said the British government wants to boost commerce with the US, its biggest single-country trading partner, even as President Donald Trump threatens widespread trade tariffs.
title: Britain Can Increase Trade With Trump’s America, Reeves Says

description: US President Donald Trump’s administration is preparing to remove sanctions imposed on a powerful aide to Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, according to a government minister in Budapest.
title: US to Drop Sanctions on Key Orban Aide, Hungarian Minister Says

description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that delegations from Russia and the US will meet in Istanbul on Thursday to discuss restoring the functioning of their embassies.
title: Lavrov Says Russia and US to Hold Talks in Turkey on Thursday

description: Romanian prosecutors have charged Calin Georgescu, the frontrunner in May’s presidential election, in an investigation into his electoral campaign.
title: Romanian Far-Right Candidate Georgescu Charged in Election Probe

description: Malawian President Lazarus Chakwera fired his trade minister, a day after protests erupted in the capital over a cost-of-living crisis in the poverty-stricken southern African nation.
title: Malawi President Fires Trade Minister After Protest Over Prices

description: The UK is in ongoing discussions with wealthy foreigners about the taxes they pay in Britain, following a backlash against a fresh crackdown on the so-called non-dom regime by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.
title: UK in ‘Open Dialogue’ on Rich Foreigner Taxes, Minister Says

description: President Donald Trump said Apple Inc. should end its diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, ramping up his pressure campaign to erase the policies from US workplaces.
title: Trump Pressures Apple to End DEI After Investors Reject Measure

description: Iran’s stockpile of uranium enriched just below the level needed for nuclear weapons surged more than 50% in the last three months, defying mounting pressure on the Islamic Republic to curb its atomic activities.
title: Iran’s Uranium Stocks Have Surged Since Trump’s Return to Office

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he’s received an invitation to meet with Donald Trump in Washington after negotiators secured a draft agreement giving the US control over half of the war-battered country’s natural resources.
title: Zelenskiy Says He May Go to Washington for Resources Deal

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams asked a federal judge to ensure the corruption charges filed against him are dismissed and can never be reinstated, alleging misconduct by prosecutors.
title: NYC Mayor Adams Asks Judge to Permanently Toss Corruption Case

description: Switzerland’s government said the chiefs of the army and the intelligence service are leaving their jobs, setting up a broad revamp of the country’s defense leadership after a series of mishaps.
title: Switzerland Set for Defense Shakeup After Series of Mishaps

description: At least 46 people were killed when a Sudanese military plane crashed into a residential area near the capital on Tuesday night, the Health Ministry said.
title: Sudanese Army Plane Crashes Near Capital, Killing at Least 46

description: A high court in Bosnia-Herzegovina has sentenced Bosnian Serb leader Milorad Dodik in absentia to one year in prison for defying the country’s top international overseer, barring him from office for six years.
title: Bosnia Serb Leader Sentenced for Defying International Envoy

description: Finland’s pro-business government, led by Prime Minister Petteri Orpo, survived a vote of no confidence in parliament brought by some opposition groups over its senior care policy.
title: Finnish Cabinet Survives Confidence Vote Over Senior Care

description: A South Korean appeals court will decide next month whether the country’s main opposition leader violated election laws, a verdict that could shape the political future of the man still considered a top contender to be the nation’s next leader.
title: South Korean Court to Rule on Opposition Leader’s Case in March

description: Gustavo Petro has antagonized Colombia’s energy industry, disrupted its health-care system and risked economic ruin in a social-media spat with Donald Trump. Now the leftist leader is trying a new tack to leave his mark on the country in the last 18 months of his presidency.
title: Colombia’s President Bets Pragmatic Pair Can Salvage His Legacy

description: When President Joe Biden put $42 billion behind making high-speed internet accessible across the US, he committed to doing it the old-fashioned way – with miles upon miles of fiber-optic lines.
title: GOP Wants Musk’s Starlink to Get a Cut of $42 Billion Biden Internet Plan

description: Romania’s far-right presidential candidate Calin Georgescu was taken for questioning by police as part of an investigation into his campaign.
title: Romania Far-Right Candidate Georgescu Brought In For Questioning

description: European Union member states need to increase defense outlays on a national level first, according to Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe, as the bloc looks for ways to take more control of its own security.
title: EU Countries Need to Boost Defense Spending, Irish Minister Says

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi Keeps Calm as Trump Targets China

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy aims to meet with Donald Trump in Washington this week to sign an agreement giving the US control over half of the war-battered country’s natural resources, according to people familiar with the plans.
title: Zelenskiy Aims for Trump Meeting as Deal on Resources Finalized

description: Australia plans to review the fallout on Southeast Asia and the Pacific of President Donald Trump’s planned cuts to USAID as Canberra’s latest foreign policy assessment warned of an “increasingly unpredictable” global strategic outlook.
title: Australia to Review Trump Aid Cuts’ Impact on Pacific Region

description: China’s no. 4 official unveiled stronger language toward Taiwan that signaled greater efforts ahead to intimidate the self-ruled democracy, as Beijing announced military exercises near the island.
title: China Takes Tougher Tone on Taiwan, Announces Military Drills

description: Thailand’s plan to legalize casinos is a “big threat” to the Philippines that’s now Asia’s second-largest gambling hub and is looking to set a new revenue record in 2025, Manila’s gaming agency chief said.
title: Philippine Gaming Chief Says Thailand Casino Push a ‘Big Threat’

description: Taiwan lowered its prediction for growth this year, signaling its concern about the impact of the Trump administration’s policies on its economy.
title: Taiwan Trims 2025 Growth Forecast as Trump Worries Mount

description: On Trumponomics, we discuss whether his rampage across Washington will set the stage for a bigger crisis, and what it means for “DOGE.”
title: Will Musk Trigger a Government Shutdown?

description: German lawmakers could move to ramp up defense spending even before a new parliament is sworn in next month, according to the country’s caretaker finance minister, Joerg Kukies.
title: German Finance Chief Sees Chance for Defense Spending Splurge

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa called for enhanced cooperation within the Group of 20 nations as his US counterpart Donald Trump upends the world order in pursuit of his America First agenda.
title: South African Leader Urges G-20 Cooperation Amid Trump Shakeup

description: Firefighters battled to extinguish a blaze that engulfed large tracts of Cape Town’s landmark Table Mountain on Wednesday before a meeting of finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of 20 nations.
title: Cape Town Battles Mountain Fires as G-20 Finance Ministers Meet

description: French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said he expects the US to provide backup for European troops to help maintain peace once a ceasefire is agreed between Ukraine and Russia.
title: France Expects US to Provide Backup After Ukraine Ceasefire

description: The US and Iraq discussed the resumption a major pipeline that can transport oil from the Middle Eastern country to global markets, after the link was shut almost two years ago following regional cost disputes.
title: US and Iraq Talk About ‘Quickly’ Resuming Key Oil Pipeline

description: The European Union will unveil a plan to improve the bloc’s competitiveness as its industries struggle to balance ambitious climate targets and increasing rivalry from the US and China.
title: EU to Pitch New Clean Deal to Industries Struggling to Compete

description: The club of finance ministers and central bankers who’ve steered the global economy through a quarter century of market meltdowns, recessions, wars and the pandemic meet this week facing new headwinds to their goal of broader prosperity — tariffs and the imminent threat of trade wars.
title: Trump Tariff Turmoil Casts a Shadow Over G-20 Meeting

description: The former head of China’s CDC has accused Elon Musk of hurting science after the special adviser to President Donald Trump cut the US budget for research as part of his efforts to slash federal spending.
title: China’s Ex-CDC Chief Slams Musk’s DOGE Cuts as ‘Anti-Science’

description: Congressman Byron Donalds says he will run for governor of Florida, a move that comes less than a week after President Donald Trump offered the lawmaker a ringing endorsement.
title: Trump Ally Seeks Florida Governor Job in Possible DeSantis Clash

description: Canada must quickly ramp up its defense spending to reach its NATO target while also weaning itself off US-made military equipment, according to the contenders to replace Justin Trudeau as prime minister.
title: US Threats Force Canada’s Liberals to Boost Military Goals

description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, who took office on Oct. 20, said he wouldn’t seek a second five-year term if his administration fails to meet public expectations, setting 2028 as a test for his leadership.
title: Prabowo Says Won’t Seek New Term If He Falls Short as Indonesia’s President

description: The Trump administration is planning to require undocumented immigrants to join a federal registry, threatening potential fines, prison time and deportation for anyone caught failing to participate.
title: Trump to Force Migrants to Join Registry or Face Fines, Prison

description: San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie is ordering city workers back in the office four day a week, following in the steps of major employers as he seeks to revive a downtown battered by remote work.
title: San Francisco Mayor Orders City Workers Back Four Days a Week

description: Chances for early action on Donald Trump’s tax cut plans improved as House Republicans passed a budget blueprint Tuesday calling for deep cuts in safety-net programs such as Medicaid.
title: Tax Cut Chances Rise as House Passes Budget Targeting Safety Net

description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on Tuesday fired Health Minister Nisia Trindade and replaced her with Institutional Relations Minister Alexandre Padilha, giving Lula the chance to name a new face to the key role of leading political negotiations with congress.
title: Lula Shuffles Cabinet With Eye to Revamp Congressional Relations

description: The White House said the head of the Department of Government Efficiency — the wide-ranging federal cost-cutting initiative associated with Elon Musk — is a little-known official named Amy Gleason.
title: Elon Musk Isn’t Running DOGE, White House Says. Amy Gleason Is
